intro: Cartrema sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran cartrema, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
